Vehicle_Losses_Dashboard.py.assistant_code:
from streamlit_folium import folium_static
from streamlit_folium import st_folium
import streamlit as st
import pandas as pd

# Set the title of the dashboard
st.title("Vehicle Losses Dashboard")

# Load the data
file_path = 'user_uploaded_files/02-24-2022_THROUGH_09-04-2024_Vehicle_Losses.csv'
data = pd.read_csv(file_path)

# Data preprocessing
# Convert 'date' column to datetime
data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='coerce')

# Extract latitude and longitude for mapping
data['lat'] = data['lat'].str.extract(r'([\d.]+)').astype(float)
data['lon'] = data['lon'].str.extract(r'([\d.]+)').astype(float)

# Sidebar for user interaction
st.sidebar.header("Filter Options")
vehicle_types = st.sidebar.multiselect("Select Vehicle Types", options=data['vehicle_type'].dropna().unique(), default=data['vehicle_type'].dropna().unique())
statuses = st.sidebar.multiselect("Select Status", options=data['status'].dropna().unique(), default=data['status'].dropna().unique())

# Filter data based on user input
filtered_data = data[(data['vehicle_type'].isin(vehicle_types)) & (data['status'].isin(statuses))]

# Display filtered data
st.subheader("Filtered Data")
st.dataframe(filtered_data)

# Visualization 1: Bar chart of vehicle losses by type
st.subheader("Vehicle Losses by Type")
vehicle_type_counts = filtered_data['vehicle_type'].value_counts()
st.bar_chart(vehicle_type_counts)

# Visualization 2: Line chart of vehicle losses over time
st.subheader("Vehicle Losses Over Time")
losses_over_time = filtered_data.groupby('date').size()
st.line_chart(losses_over_time)

# Visualization 3: Map of vehicle loss locations
st.subheader("Map of Vehicle Loss Locations")
st.map(filtered_data[['lat', 'lon']].dropna())

Fatalities_in_Israeli-Palestinian_Confli.assistant_code:
from streamlit_folium import folium_static
from streamlit_folium import st_folium
import streamlit as st
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Title of the dashboard
st.title("Fatalities in Israeli-Palestinian Conflict (2000-2023) - Histogram")

# Load the data
file_path = 'user_uploaded_files/fatalities_isr_pse_conflict_2000_to_2023.csv'
data = pd.read_csv(file_path)

# Create a histogram
st.subheader("Histogram of Ages of Fatalities")
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
ax.hist(data['age'], bins=10, edgecolor='black')
ax.set_xlabel('Age')
ax.set_ylabel('Frequency')
ax.set_title('Histogram of Ages of Fatalities')
st.pyplot(fig)

# Create a histogram for each event location region
st.subheader("Histogram of Ages of Fatalities by Event Location Region")
for region in data['event_location_region'].unique():
    region_data = data[data['event_location_region'] == region]
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.hist(region_data['age'], bins=10, edgecolor='black')
    ax.set_xlabel('Age')
    ax.set_ylabel('Frequency')
    ax.set_title(f'Histogram of Ages of Fatalities in {region}')
    st.pyplot(fig)
